name: Elaine's Peanut Butter Cookies
author: Janet Kay
summary: This is a quick recipe for cookies when you are in a crunch for time and need to have something for the dessert platter now!  These are very soft and taste great.  I have yet to have anyone toss these cookies back on my platter.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Pour the cake mix into a large bowl
Make a well in the center, and add peanut butter, oil, eggs, and water
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets
Flatten slightly using a fork dipped in water
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven
Let cookies set on cookie sheet for 2 to 3 minutes before carefully removing from the cookie sheet to cool on wire racks
